places.generalDescription: Green urban landscaped gardens with lawns, flowerbeds, seating areas & restrooms.

sources.snippet: Ratna Park is a pretty popular place among tourists, but most have rarely set foot inside. The park is known as the pick up location for most tourist buses that shuttle people to Pokhara. If you make it past the bus pick up, you‚Äôll actually see an adorable little park which is worth checking out.
sources.shortName: 50+ Places To Visit in Kathmandu: Museums, Temples, Hikes & More

places.name: Ratna Park

reviews.text: Ratna park is very nice for enjoy, sometimes meeting and friendly discussion etc.
A well kept local park, which also offers children playgrounds. Nothing spectacular from a touristic perspective. On the day I went it opened at 10.
Peace inside such crowd place.You can feel something different than previous while roaming around there, awesome.Nice experienced‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π

places.generalDescription: Swayambhu Buddha Park, also known as Swoyambhu Park, is located at the base of the Swoyambhunath Stupa in Kathmandu. The park boasts three towering gold Buddha statues, with the largest one standing at 67 feet tall and flanked by two slightly smaller statues at 64 feet each.

sources.snippet: Below Swayambhunath Stupa on the opposite side of the steep staircase, you can find the Amideva Buddha Park where three large gold statues tower above you. The park features the largest Buddha statue in Nepal which is 67 feet tall!. On either side of the main Buddha are two more statues depicting Buddha that are slightly smaller at 64 feet each.
sources.shortName: 50+ Places To Visit in Kathmandu: Museums, Temples, Hikes & More

places.name: Swayambhu Buddha Park - Ring Road

reviews.text: Place is usually quiet and peaceful. But, it was quite lively during Buddha Purnima. There are benches where you can rest and also a place for doing some exercises.

Very Interesting & beautiful place in Kathmandu, Nepal. Nature of this place is very quiet & gentle. Swayambhu Buddha Park is an another holly place for Buddhist people. The significance of this place enhances when Budhha Purnima comes. Wonderful Holly experience with joy & peace in this place.

I recently visited one of the holiest Buddhist stupas in Nepal, and despite the heavy traffic from Pashupatinath and tough parking, the peaceful atmosphere made it worth it. There are plenty good restaurant and the area felt calming once I arrived. Visiting at night adds a beautiful, serene touch-definitely worth experiencing at least once.

places.generalDescription: Freak Street, also known as Jochen Tole street, is a historic and laid-back tourist destination located just steps away from the monumental Durbar Square in Kathmandu. Once a hub for hippies drawn to the city's exoticism and affordable cannabis, it now offers numerous cafes, souvenir shops, and restaurants.

sources.snippet: Freak Street (today known as Jochne Marg) was the Thamel of the 1960s and 1960s. with awesome restaurants, strange characters and those seeking enlightenment on visiting Nepal or those who live within the country. With Kathmandu so rapidly growing and Thamel becoming the new tourist hotspot, Freak Street isn‚Äôt quite as it used to be, but don‚Äôt let that put you off going; it‚Äôs still worth a visit!
sources.shortName: The 12 BEST Places to Visit in Kathmandu, Nepal [2025]

sources.snippet: Freak Street, located on the west side of Kathmandu Durbar Square, holds a fascinating history dating back to the 1960s era. In those days, it became a heaven for hippies, who flocked to this street, making it a paradise of free spirits. During that time, cannabis ( marijuana or Ganga) was legally sold here, which eventually led to its name, Freak Street.
sources.siteName: Nepal Mother House Treks & Expedition Pvt. Ltd.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Kathmandu Worth Exploring in 2024

sources.snippet: That being said, it‚Äôs a really cool street filled with little shops and cozy restaurants. It‚Äôs located extremely close to the popular Durbar Square, so it‚Äôs a great place to stop and grab some food in between sightseeing. If you‚Äôre in the area, you can check out ZY Coffee which is just off of Freak Street and has awesome lattes (to go) for $1.
sources.shortName: 50+ Places To Visit in Kathmandu: Museums, Temples, Hikes & More

sources.snippet: Near Asam market is Freak Street, the notorious hippie enclave of thelate 60s and early 70s. Hippies gravitated here to find marijuana and spiritual experiences. Today, you won‚Äôt find hipped, but boutique shops, famous tattoo parlors and restaurants in its place.
sources.shortName: 21 Incredible Things to Do in Kathmandu, Nepal

sources.snippet: You could see the touristy market Thamel, narrow alleys, courtyards, old houses, backstreets inside, and local temples, stupas, Durbar Square, Freak Street and finally the walk towards the Monkey Temple. You will witness the ritual activities on the way.
sources.shortName: FREE WALKING TOUR KATHMANDU | Himkala Adventure
Best Free Things to do in Nepal

places.name: Freak St

reviews.text:
amazing street for walking & roamingüëå
a must visit place foreigners who seek to buy unique arts & handicratfs .

Freak Street in Thamel is a vibrant and lively part of Kathmandu! It's full of quirky shops, cafes, and restaurants with a laid-back vibe. The street has a rich history and was once a popular hangout for hippies in the 60s and 70s, giving it a unique, nostalgic charm. Whether you're looking for souvenirs, local delicacies, or just soaking in the atmosphere, Freak Street has something for everyone. It's a great place to wander, relax, and explore Kathmandu's vibrant culture!
Great area where you can see remnants of the hippies times in the 60s
